comments.commentBody:
I am wondering the same thing. 450 seems hot for all those green leaves and garlic. I
m afraid it will burn.
Yes, leave the paste on the meat for the whole roasting period.
Do you leave the herb-and-spices paste on the roast while cooking?

Oh my oh my, professor....

Keynes, General Theory, Book 4, chapter 17

"In my Treatise on Money I defined what purported to be a unique rate of interest, which I called the natural rate of interest...
....I had, however, overlooked the fact that in any given society there is, on this definition, a different natural rate of interest for each hypothetical level of employment. And, similarly, for every rate of interest there is a level of employment for which that rate is the “natural” rate, in the sense that the system will be in equilibrium with that rate of interest and that level of employment. Thus it was a mistake to speak of the natural rate of interest or to suggest that the above definition would yield a unique value for the rate of interest irrespective of the level of employment. I had not then understood that, in certain conditions, the system could be in equilibrium with less than full employment.

I am now no longer of the opinion that the concept of a “natural” rate of interest, which previously seemed to me a most promising idea, has anything very useful or significant to contribute to our analysis. It is merely the rate of interest which will preserve the status quo; and, in general, we have no predominant interest in the status quo as such."
Sounds like a good way to use up all of the extra veggies from a scoff of corned beef & cabbage.

Our Irish family has a similar recipe handed down from my Great grandmother which I make every Thanksgiving - but with some rutabagas as well as carrots and parsnips, no milk and a bit more butter. For a bit more flavor I cook all the vegetables in chicken broth.
It is an excellent side dish which I should make more often than once a year!

Another suggestion.... Talk to a woman you might presume will be a sexual partner....  Don't just presume that because you are alone in a room together a woman is necessarily a willing sexual  partner.... This isn't rocket science, truly.... Language and the presumption that the human being sitting (or even laying) in front of you, is the most humane and human way of determining the actual humanity of the both of you.... Really.... Just stop and think. It's not freaking rocket science.

I don't understand why so many would be bothering to respond to the survey if the only problem they had ever encountered was a kiss on the cheek. Who in the world remembers a kiss on the cheek? Who in the world forgets that they've been raped?
Good luck with that. Currently the Republicans are spending their energy on repealing the ACA.

This story tells us that the medical insurance is a huge rip off and if this is the case of a physician who is well versed in the system, what about the common folks? It is high time that congress act on making fundamental changes and keep doctors out of this endless paperwork that reduces their valuable time in taking care of patients the way the system was meant to work.

Sexual exploitation of human beings is shocking and unconscionable  whether it is against men or women, but abuse of boys still gets a reaction whereas abuse of girls is part of conflict.  All of it must stop and the US cannot dismiss it out of hand as cultural deviation nor use it as a human rights bargaining chip.  We have done both with impunity.
One of the aspects is that that's why the Afghans liked the Taliban; the Taliban did not tolerate this type of sexual abuse.

.
So, the Wizard and Dorothy had the same name?

WYSIWYG

Men turn to boys as a sexual substitute when women are covered...and unavailable??? Men who derive pleasure from torturing and raping screaming boys who are chained in place are predatory psychopathic homosexual pedophiles. Naked women would make no difference. I assure you that I, as a healthy heterosexual woman, would never engage in the torture and rape of girls if men were covered, segregated, and unavailable to me.

I don't agree about the croissants, and only partly about the baguettes.  For a truly good croissant go to La Toulousaine on Amsterdam between 107th and 108th Sts., Manhattan.  Theirs are better than any others I've had in the U.S. (and some in France).  Their baguette is also excellent.

.
Dizzy and Paris were also 2 Trouts.

But only one was a real person.

It is no more difficult than it is to understand how Ronald Reagan, a hapless and hopelessly inarticulate man when he was not reading a script, and George Bush the younger, who displayed ignorance nearly every time he spoke, could ever get elected either. But both of them were governors too, and they did. The fact is, you can fool a lot of the American people a lot of the time, and at any given time 20% to 30% already lean toward fascistic nationalism. Republicans are very good at this.
Just thank the gods for the tireless, thankless job performed by state employees who keep things running despite the boneheaded decisions made by elected politicians and their cronies.
Elected officials are marionettes. As such and due to natural selection, uneeded traits such as intelligence, knowledge etc. are eventually removed from the universe of potential candidates.

It is difficult to get comprehend the fact that these mediocre, colorless, clueless, uninformed and ignorant people (Walker, Perry, Christie, Bush) are or were governors of states and therefore responsible for the welfare and governance of millions of people, or are senators (Cruz, Rubio) responsible for representing millions and passing legislation in their name.  How does this happen?  How does the country function?  What ever happened to stature, knowledge and intelligence no matter what political creed?
Well it doesn't make any sense from a scientific standpoint. Science has dispelled the notion that sweets  make  kids out of control.

The system is rigged to be obstructionist, difficult and not consumer-patient friendly. No wonder our population is having such difficulty getting well and lives in fear of any illness overtaking their lives.
I am a physician who has had equal difficulty nagivating the system.
My brother is a physician who has Parkinson's disease.
His co-pay in monthly medication costs were outrageous. I was able to guide him to a reputable online pharmacy north of our border where pharmacists receive faxed prescriptions and are easily available by phone.
Automatic renewals are mailed and you are given email notification of expiring ones. All very civilized.
When the Insurance health hospital industry and big pharma stop the blitzkrieg of advertising and put that obscene amount of money toward stream lining the system, patient care and physician support only then will I ever trust what one of them tells us again.
Easy and delicious! Quick too.

Nothing short of vile and repulsive, that our professional military, who are trained to defend the defenseless, are disciplined for doing their job, doing what is right, morally and ethically.

As if this scandal could not be more disgusting, Army Secretary McHugh's remarks on sexual assault prevention at the Pentagon make the military's official stance on this issue all the more hypocritical.

Someone with access to this guy needs to point this out.

http://www.army.mil/article/145635/Mar__31__2015____SecArmy_s_remarks_at...
Any man who is considering a career in the military should read this, and other articles about how the US military, as a policy, aids and abets systematic child abuse.

You do not throw rocks when you live in a glass house. The culture of war brings rape, human rights abuses and murder regardless of the geography. US soldiers have been accused of war crimes in both Afghanistan and Iraq (http://www.thenation.com/article/us-special-forces-may-have-gone-on-a-mu... if you begin to criticize your allies for abuse, they may begin to do the same of you. Then the US military will be forced to hold their own soldiers at equal standards. The soldiers who spoke out against this abuse are truly courageous.

S'lichot.

And as many campaigners as you think you can tolerate.

To think that once upon a time the NDP was considered a farce!

and Elke
Started out with PYROmaniac and reluctantly changed it to PYROTECHNIST, which is in the New Oxford Amer. Dict. on my Kindle. This gave a good basis for the rest .
"Dodo" before DOLT ,which meant "Boris Godunov" was a TSAR , not an opera. Had "Oct" before NOV; we vote here on Oct.19 this year, after a record 79-day long campaign . Some Canadians only natter on XWP blogs.....
Tried to protect the "crown jewel" (sing.) before SHIN.......
After getting the pun, started looking for Toto, I think I found him hiding in T-OTO-LARYNGOLOGIS-T ,ready to have the WIZARD unVEILED.
Do MASSAGETHERAPISTs also work on bruised egos ?
Was a TEENY EXPO fan, am now cheering for another blue team. SORRY !

Will be back later in the week; play nice in the meanwhile.

A research study published in the Journal of Abnormal Psychology took 5 to 7 year olds labeled by their mothers as “sugar-sensitive” were separated into two groups. While both sets of children were given the exact same sugar-free drink, one group was told their kids got a large dose of sugar and the other was told the truth.

The mothers who were told their children were given sugar rated their children as significantly more hyperactive. This study highlights how just having the expectation that sugar causes adverse behavior makes it seem like a reality.
To condone, or look the other way at behavior at least as horrific as that of the Taliban, is shameful.  Tax dollars supporting Afghan pedophiles. I thought I had heard everything.
I'm in tears as well. Very sad for the children.

Americans should travel to the UK for a sensibly priced and rigorous undergrad education. The process there is far less painful.

Let the Indians and Chinese get suckered into paying the astronomical fees of US varsities.

Years ago I was told by a close Middle Eastern male friend that since women in Muslem countries are untouchable except by their husbands, that many men turn to boys for pre or extramarital sexual activity. He said that this was a common if not always approved practice. the Muslem injunction against casual heterosexual sexual activity is so strong and such activity so dangerous that the prohibition is highly respected and observed. This article did not surprise me.

We have been told that such things, being it men abusing boys, or women abusing girls, are a matter completely separate from 'same-sex' abuse, and that all such directions -though within the same sex- were heterosexual "paedophilia". The same sex or homosexual aspect has always been denied - even where it was absolutely clear: with the thousands of such abuses among boy scouts, and of course 95% of the priests and nuns who were singled out for pro- and persecution (the latter, because the money that became involved for even unproven abuse caused many false accusations).
What surfaced there in Afghanistan is the wide-spread homosexuality in countries with a long "harem" tradition which withdraws many of the women from the marriage scope and, thus, encourages homosexual "ersatz" activities. The focus on younger people which is not unusual (even down to our famous Harvey Milk) combined with power structures, leads then to the excesses described in these reports.
Any tolerance here - just because "they are our allies" is, of course, a total deviation from all principles of human rights and responsibility. However, this being militay, it does not really surprise, does it?
